# Pull Request Template

## Description

Please provide a clear and concise description of the changes proposed in this pull request.  Explain the "why" behind the changes and what problem they solve.  If it relates to a specific issue, please reference it.

**Example:**

> Fixes #123: Implements the new user authentication flow.  This change addresses the security vulnerability reported by [mention reporter if applicable] and improves the overall user experience by simplifying the login process.

## Related Issues/Tickets

* [Link to issue 1](https://github.com/your-org/your-repo/issues/1)
* [Link to issue 2](https://github.com/your-org/your-repo/issues/2) (Optional)

## Type of Change

Please check the boxes that apply:

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Code refactoring (improves code structure without changing functionality)
- [ ] Documentation update (changes to documentation)
- [ ] Build/CI improvement (changes to build or continuous integration)
- [ ] Other (please specify: __________)

## Checklist

- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my code.
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works.
- [ ] I have updated the documentation (if applicable).
- [ ] I have followed the project's coding style guidelines.
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the website/documentation if needed. (Optional)

## Testing Instructions

Please provide clear instructions on how to test the changes in this pull request.

**Example:**

> 1. Check out the branch: `git checkout your-branch`
> 2. Run the application: `npm run start`
> 3. Navigate to the login page: `http://localhost:3000/login`
> 4. Verify that the new login form is displayed.
> 5. ...

## Screenshots (if applicable)

If the changes involve visual elements, please include screenshots to demonstrate the changes.

## Further comments (optional)

Add any other relevant information or context about the pull request.  This could include alternative solutions considered, potential trade-offs, or open questions.
